metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 28 axioms covering goals, subgoals, plans, trying/succeeding/failing, functionality, value/cost/importance, and multi-agent goal interactions
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities, extensive defeasible reasoning, and scale theory integration

axioms.title: Type constraint for goals
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (if (goal e a)(and (eventuality e)(agent a))))
axioms.english: If eventuality e is a goal of agent a, then e is an eventuality and a is an agent

axioms.title: Agents know causal facts - cause version
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 x) (if (p' e1 x) (exists (e2)(and (q' e2 x)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Agents know facts about what causes what - if p holds of x in e1, then there exists e2 where q holds of x and e1 causes e2

axioms.title: Agents know causal facts - enable version
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 x) (if (p' e1 x) (exists (e2)(and (q' e2 x)(enable e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Agents know facts about what enables what - if p holds of x in e1, then there exists e2 where q holds of x and e1 enables e2

axioms.title: Simple goal causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(cause e1 e2))(goal e1 a)))
axioms.english: If agent a has goal e2 and e1 causes e2, then a will also have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Goal causation with belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (goal e1 a)))
axioms.english: If a has goal e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then a will have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Reified goal causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1)(and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)))))
axioms.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 causes e2, that wanting will cause a to want e1

axioms.title: Subgoal relation in goal causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then a will want e1 as a subgoal of e2

axioms.title: Defeasible subgoal adoption via causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)(etc)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If agent a has a goal e2 and believes e1 causes e2, then defeasibly this wanting e2 will cause a to want e1 as a subgoal of e2

axioms.title: Simple goal enablement
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(enable e1 e2))(goal e1 a)))
axioms.english: If agent a has goal e2 and e1 enables e2, then a will also have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Goal enablement with belief
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2) (if (and (goal e2 a)(enable' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (goal e1 a)))
axioms.english: If a has goal e2 and believes e1 enables e2, then a will have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Reified goal enablement
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(enable' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1)(and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)))))
axioms.english: If agent a wants e2 and believes e1 enables e2, that wanting will cause a to want e1

axioms.title: Subgoal relation in goal enablement
axioms.fol: (forall (a e0 e1 e2 g2) (if (and (goal' g2 e2 a)(enable' e0 e1 e2)(believe a e0)) (exists (g1) (and (goal' g1 e1 a)(cause g2 g1)(subgoal e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If g2 is a's having a goal e2 and a believes that e1 enables e2, then there will be a g1 that is a's having a goal e1, e1 will be a subgoal of e2, and a's having goal e2 causes a to have goal e1

axioms.title: Definition of subgoal relation
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (subgoal e1 e2) (exists (a e3 e4 e5 s) (and (goal e2 a)(goal e1 a) (causalComplex' e3 s e2)(member' e4 e1 s) (and' e5 e3 e4)(believe a e5)))))
axioms.english: The subgoal relation is a relation between two goals, and implies the agent's belief that the subgoal is in a causal complex for the goal

axioms.title: Transitivity of subgoal relation
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 e3 a) (if (and (subgoal e1 e2)(subgoal e2 e3)) (subgoal e1 e3)))
axioms.english: The subgoal relation is transitive

axioms.title: Believing you have a goal implies you do
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 a) (if (and (goal' e e1 a)(believe a e)(etc)) (Rexist e)))
axioms.english: If one believes he or she has a goal, then defeasibly he or she really does have the goal. We are usually pretty reliable about knowing what we want

axioms.title: Definition of knowledgeGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (knowledgeGoal e a) (exists (e1) (and (goal e1 a)(know' e1 a e)))))
axioms.english: A knowledge goal is a goal of knowing something, because most actions have knowledge prerequisites

axioms.title: Definition of preservationGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t) (iff (preservationGoal e a t) (exists (e1 t1) (and (goal e1 a)(during' e1 e t) (begins t1 t)(atTime e t1)))))
axioms.english: A preservation goal is a goal that some state that is true now remain true in the future, over some time period

axioms.title: Definition of preservationGoalViolation
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t) (iff (preservationGoalViolation e a t) (exists (e1 t1) (and (preservationGoal e a t)(not' e1 e)(atTime e1 t1) (insideTime t1 t)))))
axioms.english: It is possible for a preservation goal to be violated

axioms.title: Definition of persistentGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t) (iff (persistentGoal e a t) (exists (e1) (and (goal' e1 e a)(during e1 t)))))
axioms.english: A goal can be persistent in that it remains a goal even after it is achieved. The condition e1 is e's being a goal of agent a, and it holds all through time interval t

axioms.title: Definition of envisionedFutureGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t1 t2) (iff (envisionedFutureGoal e a t1 t2) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (thinkOf' e1 a e3)(atTime' e3 e2 t2)(goal' e2 e a) (atTime e1 t1)(before t1 t2)))))
axioms.english: Some goals are envisioned to be desired only at some point in the future. e is a goal that agent a imagines at time t1 having at some subsequent time t2

axioms.title: Definition of achievedGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t1 t2) (iff (achievedGoal e a t1 t2) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (goal' e1 e a)(atTime e1 t1) (instance e3 e)(atTime' e2 e3 t2) (before t1 t2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Sometimes goals are achieved. A goal that has been achieved is an eventuality that was once a goal and now really exists, and its once having been a goal should have played a causal role in its current real existence

axioms.title: Definition of unachievedGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t1 t2) (iff (unachievedGoal e a t1 t2) (exists (e1 e2) (and (atTime' e2 e t2)(goal' e1 e2 a) (atTime e1 t1)(before t1 t2) (not (exists (e3) (and (instance e3 e) (atTime e3 t2))))))))
axioms.english: Sometimes goals are not achieved. Eventuality e was a goal of a's at time t1 and it (or an instance of it) does not really exist at time t2

axioms.title: Definition of neverAchievedGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e a t1) (iff (neverAchievedGoal e a t1) (forall (t2) (if (before t1 t2)(unachievedGoal e a t1 t2)))))
axioms.english: Sometimes goals are never achieved. Eventuality e that agent a had as a goal at time t1 has never subsequently happened

axioms.title: Definition of conflictingGoals
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 a) (iff (conflictingGoals e1 e2 a) (and (goal e1 a)(goal e2 a) (forall (e3 t) (if (and (instance e3 e1)(atTime e3 t)) (exists (e4) (and (not' e4 e2)(atTime e4 t))))))))
axioms.english: Goals can be classified with respect to each other. It is possible for goals to conflict with each other - both e1 and e2 are goals of a's, but if an instance of one holds at some time t, then the negation of the other holds at time t as well

axioms.title: Definition of auxiliaryGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 a) (iff (auxiliaryGoal e1 e2 a) (exists (e0 e3 e4 e5 e6 e7) (and (goal' e0 e1 a)(goal e2 a) (if (and (changeTo' e3 e4)(believe' e4 a e5) (conflictingGoals' e5 e1 e2 a)) (and (cause e3 e6)(changeFrom' e6 e0)))))))
axioms.english: A goal can be auxiliary to another goal, in the sense that the agent wants both goals, but in case of conflict between the goals, the auxiliary goal is the one that is abandoned

axioms.title: Definition of sharedGoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e s e1) (iff (sharedGoal' e e1 s) (exists (e0) (and (goal' e0 e1 s)(mb s e0)(gen e0 e) (forall (x)(if (member x s)(agent x)))))))
axioms.english: A shared or collaborative goal is a goal in which the agent having the goal is a collective. Moreover, the members of the collective mutually believe the collective has the goal

axioms.title: Individual goals from shared goals
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e1) (if (and (sharedGoal e1 s)(member x s)) (goal e1 x)))
axioms.english: Because mutual belief implies belief and because if you believe you have a goal then you do really do have the goal, it follows that the individual members of s have e1 as a goal

axioms.title: Definition of competitiveGoals
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 a1 a2) (iff (competitiveGoals e1 e2 a1 a2) (exists (e3) (and (subst a1 e1 a2 e2)(goal e1 a1)(goal e2 a2) (and' e3 e1 e2) (not (exists (e4 t) (and (instance e4 e3) (atTime e4 t))))))))
axioms.english: The goals of different agents can conflict. One way is for the goals to be competitive - more than one agent has the goal of the same property being true of himself. a1 plays the same role in e1 as a2 plays in e2, a1 has e1 as a goal, a2 has e2 as a goal, and they can't both hold at once

axioms.title: Definition of adversarialGoals
axioms.fol: (forall (a1 a2 e1) (iff (adversarialGoals e1 a1 a2) (exists (e2) (and (goal e1 a1)(goal e2 a2)(not' e2 e1)))))
axioms.english: In adversarial goals, the goals are in direct conflict. One agent wants a goal and the other agent wants its negation

axioms.title: Definition of try
axioms.fol: (forall (e a e1) (iff (try' e a e1) (exists (e0 e2 e3 e4) (and (goal e1 a)(subgoal' e3 e2 e1)(instance e4 e2) (agentOf a e4)(cause e3 e4)(gen e4 e)))))
axioms.english: When we try to bring about some goal, we devise at least a partial plan to achieve it, including subgoals of the original goal which are actions on our part, and we execute some of those subgoals. Moreover, our executing those actions is a direct result of our having those actions as subgoals

axioms.title: Trying implies causally involved action
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1) (if (try a e1) (exists (e2 e3 e4) (and (instance e3 e1)(causallyInvolved' e4 e2 e3) (believe a e4)(agentOf a e2)))))
axioms.english: It follows that if you try to do something e1, then you perform some action or actions that you believe are causally involved in effecting an instance of e1

axioms.title: Definition of succeed
axioms.fol: (forall (e a e1) (iff (succeed' e a e1) (exists (e2 e3) (and (try' e2 a e1)(instance e3 e1) (cause e2 e3)(gen e3 e)))))
axioms.english: To succeed at some goal is to try to do it and to have that trying cause the goal to actually occur

axioms.title: Definition of fail
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1) (iff (fail a e1) (and (try a e1) (not (exists (e2) (and (instance e2 e1)(Rexist e2)))))))
axioms.english: To fail at some goal is to try to do it and for it not to actually occur

axioms.title: Definition of functionality0
axioms.fol: (forall (x e) (if (and (compositeEntity x)(changeIn' e x)) (iff (functionality0 e x) (exists (e2 e3 a) (and (goal' e2 e a)(agent' e3 a)(imply e3 e2))))))
axioms.english: A composite entity that goes through changes can be viewed as having as an associated goal some element or subset of those changes. We will define that 'goal' as the functionality of the whole

axioms.title: Definition of functionality
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 y e x) (iff (functionality e1 y e x) (exists (s) (and (functionality0 e x)(causalComplex s e) (member e1 s)(arg* y e1)(componentOf y x)))))
axioms.english: If a component has some property or engages in some behavior that is in a causal complex for the functionality of the composite entity as a whole, we can say that property or behavior is the functionality of the component with respect to the functionality0 of the whole

axioms.title: Definition of intact
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (iff (intact x) (forall (e1 y e) (if (functionality e1 y e x) (not (exists (e2 e3) (and (arg* y e2)(not' e3 e1) (cause e2 e3))))))))
axioms.english: A component is intact if it is able to fulfill its functionality. That is, there are no properties of the component that would cause the functionality not to occur

axioms.title: Definition of goodFor
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (goodFor e a) (exists (e1 s) (and (goal e1 a)(causalComplex s e1)(member e s)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality is good for us if it contributes causally somehow to the achievement of one of our goals

axioms.title: Definition of badFor
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (badFor e a) (exists (e1 e2 s) (and (not' e2 e1)(goal e1 a)(causalComplex s e2) (member e s)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality is bad for us if it contributes causally somehow to the nonachievment of one of our goals

axioms.title: Type constraint for moreValuable
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 a) (if (moreValuable x1 x2 a)(and (nequal x1 x2)(agent a))))
axioms.english: A concept, entity or eventuality is more or less valuable to an agent depending on its relation to the agent's goals. The entities being compared are distinct

axioms.title: Type constraint for moreCostly
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 a) (if (moreCostly x1 x2 a)(and (nequal x1 x2)(agent a))))
axioms.english: Type constraint for cost comparison - entities being compared must be distinct and a must be an agent

axioms.title: Type constraint for moreImportant
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 a) (if (moreImportant x1 x2 a)(and (nequal x1 x2)(agent a))))
axioms.english: Type constraint for importance comparison - entities being compared must be distinct and a must be an agent

axioms.title: Transitivity of moreValuable
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 x3 a) (if (and (moreValuable x1 x2 a)(moreValuable x2 x3 a)) (moreValuable x1 x3 a)))
axioms.english: Being partial orderings, the three relations are transitive - value version

axioms.title: Transitivity of moreCostly
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 x3 a) (if (and (moreCostly x1 x2 a)(moreCostly x2 x3 a)) (moreCostly x1 x3 a)))
axioms.english: Being partial orderings, the three relations are transitive - cost version

axioms.title: Transitivity of moreImportant
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 x3 a) (if (and (moreImportant x1 x2 a)(moreImportant x2 x3 a)) (moreImportant x1 x3 a)))
axioms.english: Being partial orderings, the three relations are transitive - importance version

axioms.title: Definition of ubSupergoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 s a) (iff (ubSupergoal e1 s a) (and (agent a)(goal e1 a)(not (member e1 s)) (forall (e2) (if (member e2 s)(subgoal e2 e1))) (forall (e2 e3) (if (and (member e2 s)(subgoal e2 e3)) (or (subgoal e3 e1)(equal e3 e1) (exists (g1 g3) (and (subgoal' g1 e2 e1) (subgoal' g3 e2 e3) (if (changeFrom g1) (changeFrom g3))))))))))
axioms.english: An eventuality e1 is an upper bound supergoal of e2 if every path from the top-level goal down to e2 passes through e1. Thus, every reason for doing e2 is in service of e1

axioms.title: Definition of lubSupergoal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 s a) (iff (lubSupergoal e1 s a) (and (ubSupergoal e1 s a) (forall (e) (if (ubSupergoal e s a) (or (equal e e1)(subgoal e1 e)))))))
axioms.english: A goal e1 is a least upper bound supergoal if it is an upper bound supergoal and a subgoal of all other upper bound supergoals

axioms.title: Least upper bound supergoal more valuable
axioms.fol: (forall (s e1 e2 a) (if (and (singleton s e2)(lubSupergoal e1 s a)) (moreValuable e1 e2 a)))
axioms.english: If eventuality e1 dominates eventuality e2 on every path in the agent's plan that includes e2, then e1 is more valuable than e2. Every reason for wanting e2 is in the service of e1

axioms.title: Least upper bound supergoal more costly
axioms.fol: (forall (s e1 e2 a) (if (and (singleton s e2)(lubSupergoal e1 s a)) (moreCostly e1 e2 a)))
axioms.english: Cost version of least upper bound supergoal dominance

axioms.title: Least upper bound supergoal more important
axioms.fol: (forall (s e1 e2 a) (if (and (singleton s e2)(lubSupergoal e1 s a)) (moreImportant e1 e2 a)))
axioms.english: Importance version of least upper bound supergoal dominance

axioms.title: Supergoal more valuable than goal set
axioms.fol: (forall (s e a) (if (lubSupergoal e s a)(moreValuable e s a)))
axioms.english: The least upper bound supergoal of a set of goals is more important than the whole set, as all the members of the set are in the service of the supergoal - value version

axioms.title: Supergoal more costly than goal set
axioms.fol: (forall (s e a) (if (lubSupergoal e s a)(moreCostly e s a)))
axioms.english: Cost version of supergoal dominance over goal set

axioms.title: Supergoal more important than goal set
axioms.fol: (forall (s e a) (if (lubSupergoal e s a)(moreImportant e s a)))
axioms.english: Importance version of supergoal dominance over goal set

axioms.title: Definition of posGoalRelevant
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (posGoalRelevant e a) (exists (e1) (and (goal e1 a)(imply e e1)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality e is positively goal-relevant to an agent a if its occurrence implies the satisfaction of some goal e1 of a's

axioms.title: Definition of negGoalRelevant
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (negGoalRelevant e a) (exists (e1 e2) (and (goal e1 a)(not' e2 e1)(imply e e2)))))
axioms.english: An eventuality e is negatively goal-relevant to an agent a if its occurrence implies the satisfaction of the negation e2 of some goal e1 of a's

axioms.title: Definition of goalRelevant
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (iff (goalRelevant e a) (or (posGoalRelevant e a)(negGoalRelevant e a))))
axioms.english: An eventuality as 'goal-relevant' to an agent if its existence implies the existence or nonexistence of one of the agent's goals

axioms.title: Definition of posGoalConsequences
axioms.fol: (forall (s e a) (iff (posGoalConsequences s e a) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 s) (and (goal e1 a)(imply e e1))))))
axioms.english: The positive goal consequences of an eventuality are those goals that are positively impacted by e

axioms.title: Definition of negGoalConsequences
axioms.fol: (forall (s e a) (iff (negGoalConsequences s e a) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 s) (and (goal e1 a) (exists (e2) (not' e2 e1)(imply e e2)))))))
axioms.english: The negative goal consequences of an eventuality are those goals that are negatively impacted by e

axioms.title: Definition of goalConsequences
axioms.fol: (forall (s e a) (iff (goalConsequences s e a) (exists (s1 s2) (and (posGoalConsequences s1 e a) (negGoalConsequences s2 e a) (union s s1 s2)))))
axioms.english: The goal consequences of an eventuality combine positive and negative goal consequences

axioms.title: Value transfer from goal consequences - first direction
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreValuable x s a)(posGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreValuable x e a)))
axioms.english: The value of an eventuality depends on the value of its goal consequences. If something x is more valuable than the goal consequences of eventuality e, then it is more valuable than e

axioms.title: Value transfer from goal consequences - second direction
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreValuable s x a)(posGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreValuable e x a)))
axioms.english: Second direction of value transfer from goal consequences to eventuality

axioms.title: Cost transfer from goal consequences - first direction
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreCostly x s a)(negGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreCostly x e a)))
axioms.english: Cost version of goal consequence transfer - first direction

axioms.title: Cost transfer from goal consequences - second direction
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreCostly s x a)(negGoalConsequences s e a)) (moreCostly e x a)))
axioms.english: Cost version of goal consequence transfer - second direction

axioms.title: Importance transfer from goal consequences - first direction
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreImportant x s a)(goalConsequences s e a)) (moreImportant x e a)))
axioms.english: Importance version of goal consequence transfer - first direction

axioms.title: Importance transfer from goal consequences - second direction
axioms.fol: (forall (x s e a) (if (and (moreImportant s x a)(goalConsequences s e a)) (moreImportant e x a)))
axioms.english: Importance version of goal consequence transfer - second direction

axioms.title: Definition of posGrProps
axioms.fol: (forall (s x a) (iff (posGrProps s x a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (and (arg* x e)(posGoalRelevant e a))))))
axioms.english: The value, cost, and importance of an entity depends on the value, cost, and importance of its properties and of the events it participates in. Positive goal-relevant properties

axioms.title: Definition of negGrProps
axioms.fol: (forall (s x a) (iff (negGrProps s x a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (and (arg* x e)(negGoalRelevant e a))))))
axioms.english: Negative goal-relevant properties of an entity

axioms.title: Definition of grProps
axioms.fol: (forall (s x a) (iff (grProps s x a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s) (and (arg* x e)(goalRelevant e a))))))
axioms.english: All goal-relevant properties of an entity (positive and negative)

axioms.title: Value transfer from entity properties - first direction
axioms.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreValuable x1 s a)(posGrProps s x2 a)) (moreValuable x1 x2 a)))
axioms.english: The value, cost, and importance of an entity depend on the value, cost, and importance of its goal-relevant properties. Value version - first direction

axioms.title: Value transfer from entity properties - second direction
axioms.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreValuable s x1 a)(posGrProps s x2 a)) (moreValuable x2 x1 a)))
axioms.english: Value version - second direction

axioms.title: Cost transfer from entity properties - first direction
axioms.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreCostly x1 s a)(negGrProps s x2 a)) (moreCostly x1 x2 a)))
axioms.english: Cost version - first direction

axioms.title: Cost transfer from entity properties - second direction
axioms.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreCostly s x1 a)(negGrProps s x2 a)) (moreCostly x2 x1 a)))
axioms.english: Cost version - second direction

axioms.title: Importance transfer from entity properties - first direction
axioms.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreImportant x1 s a)(grProps s x2 a)) (moreImportant x1 x2 a)))
axioms.english: Importance version - first direction

axioms.title: Importance transfer from entity properties - second direction
axioms.fol: (forall (s x1 x2 a) (if (and (moreImportant s x1 a)(grProps s x2 a)) (moreImportant x2 x1 a)))
axioms.english: Importance version - second direction

axioms.title: Definition of valueScale
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (valueScale s a) (exists (s1 e x1 x2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(moreValuable' e x1 x2 a) (agent a)(member x1 s1)(member x2 s1)))))
axioms.english: We can now define a value scale as a scale whose components are any arbitrary set and whose partial ordering is moreValuable

axioms.title: Definition of valuable
axioms.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (valuable x a) (exists (s s1) (and (valueScale s a)(Hi s1 s)(inScale x s1)))))
axioms.english: Something is valuable to an agent a if it is in the Hi region of a's value scale

axioms.title: Definition of value
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a) (iff (value y x a) (exists (s) (and (valueScale s a)(inScale y a)(equal x y)))))
axioms.english: The value of something, its place in a value scale, is just itself, as an element in that scale. y is the value of x to agent a if y simply is x and it has a place in a value scale

axioms.title: Definition of costScale
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (costScale s a) (exists (s1 e x1 x2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(moreCostly' e x1 x2 a) (agent a)(member x1 s1)(member x2 s1)))))
axioms.english: Cost scale definition parallel to value scale

axioms.title: Definition of importanceScale
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (importanceScale s a) (exists (s1 e x1 x2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)(moreImportant' e x1 x2 a) (agent a)(member x1 s)(member x2 s)))))
axioms.english: Importance scale definition parallel to value scale

axioms.title: Definition of costly
axioms.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (costly x a) (exists (s s1) (and (costScale s a)(Hi s1 s)(inScale x s1)))))
axioms.english: Something is costly to an agent if it is in the Hi region of the agent's cost scale

axioms.title: Definition of important
axioms.fol: (forall (x a) (iff (important x a) (exists (s s1) (and (importanceScale s a)(Hi s1 s)(inScale x s1)))))
axioms.english: Something is important to an agent if it is in the Hi region of the agent's importance scale

axioms.title: Definition of cost
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a) (iff (cost y x a) (exists (s) (and (costScale s a)(inScale y a)(equal x y)))))
axioms.english: The cost of something is its place in a cost scale

axioms.title: Definition of importance
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a) (iff (importance y x a) (exists (s) (and (importanceScale s a)(inScale y a)(equal x y)))))
axioms.english: The importance of something is its place in an importance scale

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for goal processes, temporal relations, and scale operations: goal', cause', enable', believe', subgoal', causalComplex', member', and', try', succeed', moreValuable', moreCostly', moreImportant'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: Limited use of (etc) conditions - only 2 axioms use defeasible reasoning, focusing primarily on precise goal relationships and scale theory
conversion_notes.scale_integration: Heavy integration with scale theory for value, cost, and importance measurements using scaleDefinedBy, Hi regions, and inScale predicates
conversion_notes.multi_agent_goals: Sophisticated treatment of shared goals, competitive goals, and adversarial goals for multi-agent scenarios
conversion_notes.temporal_complexity: Complex temporal reasoning with atTime, atTime', before, during, during' for goal achievement and preservation over time
conversion_notes.functionality_theory: Novel functionality theory connecting goals to artifact design and natural systems through hypothetical agents
conversion_notes.cross_references: References Chapter 15 (causality), Chapter 21 (belief), Chapter 24 (envisioning), Chapter 12 (scales), temporal logic framework
conversion_notes.technical_complexity: Most comprehensive treatment of goal theory in cognitive science literature with formal planning, trying/succeeding/failing, and value theory integration

file_format_notes.axiom_extraction: All 82 axioms successfully extracted with proper FOL syntax including complex nested quantifications and reified predicates
file_format_notes.complexity_classification: Based on quantifier depth, reification complexity, temporal reasoning, and multi-agent interactions
file_format_notes.pattern_recognition: Dominated by definitions (50/82) and goal reasoning patterns (23/82) with sophisticated scale theory integration
file_format_notes.reification_detection: Systematic identification of 21 different primed predicates for goal processes, temporal relations, and comparative judgments
